NewsLines.HeadLine: SHORT PROFILE: exiled Catalan separatist leader Carles Puigdemont

body.content.p: Short profile of Catalan separatist leader Carles Puigdemont said Thursday he would run in Catalonia's snap May election in a move which could bring forward his return to Spain after years of self-imposed exile. "I have decided to run in the next elections for Catalonia's parliament," he told supporters in Elne, a small town in southern France near the border with Spain. SHORT PROFILE OF

SHOTLIST
WATERLOO, WALLOON BRABANT PROVINCE, BELGIUM
JULY 7, 2021
SOURCE: AFPTV
IMAGES (00:23)
1. 00:04-00:16 Zoom out recently released Catalan separatists exiting the Casa de la Republica Catalana in Waterloo with former Catalan president Carles Puigdemont
2. 00:16-00:20 Mid shot recently released Catalan separatists Carme Forcadell (left), Meritxell Serret (2nd left), Oriol Junqueras (3rd left), Dolors Bassa (3rd right) and Raul Romeva (2nd right), posing with Carles Puigdemont (center) and Catalan MEP Toni Comin (right)in front of the Casa de la Republica Catalana in Waterloo
3. 00:20-00:24 Close-up Oriol Junqueras (left) and former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont
4. 00:24-00:28 Mid shot recently released catalan separatists Oriol Junqueras (center), Meritxell Serret (left) and former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont
BRUSSELS, BELGIUM
JUNE 3, 2021
SOURCE: AFPTV
IMAGES (00:07)
5. 00:28-00:31 Mid shot Antoni Comín, Carles Puigdemont and Clara Ponsatí at the beginning of the press conference
6. 00:31-00:35 Wide shot Antoni Comín, Carles Puigdemont and Clara Ponsatí at the beginning of the press conference
BRUSSELS, BELGIUM
MARCH 9, 2021
SOURCE: AFPTV
IMAGES (00:36)
7. 00:35-00:46 Wide shot Carles Puigdemont, Clara Ponsati and Toni Comin singing at protest after press conference
8. 00:46-00:50 Close-up Carles Puigdemont singing at protest
9. 00:50-00:59 Pan left from press to protesters singing
10. 00:59-01:05 Mid shot Carles Puigdemont, Clara Ponsati and Toni Comin clapping and shouting "Libertad" (ed: Freedom)
11. 01:05-01:11 Tilt up Carles Puigdemont clapping and shouting "Libertad"

-----------------------------------------------------------
AFP TEXT STORY:
URGENT ¥¥¥ Exiled separatist Puigdemont says to run in Catalonia snap poll
Elne, France, March 21, 2024 (AFP) -
Catalan separatist leader Carles Puigdemont said Thursday he would run in Catalonia's snap May election in a move which could bring forward his return to Spain after years of self-imposed exile.
"I have decided to run in the next elections for Catalonia's parliament," he told supporters in Elne, a small town in southern France near the border with Spain.
burs-hmw/CHZ/imm
